topic.title: Building and Using RSS Bandit plugins

keywords.keyword: Building and Using RSS Bandit plugins

para.style: margin-top:19px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: Building and Using RSS Bandit plugins

para.style: margin-top:19px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: RSS Bandit Support for the IBlogExtension

para.style: line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: RSS Bandit provides support for plug-ins via the

text.style: font-family:'Courier New'; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: interface. The interface provides a simple extensibility point for aggregators to be able to hook into 3rd party blogging tools. To read about the development of this extension, review visit

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.style: margin-top:14px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: When you right click a feed item within RSS Bandit, you'll notice the following two menu options

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.style: margin-top:14px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;
line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.style: margin-top:14px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: (you might have others if you already have some plugins installed). Building a plugin that implements the

text.style: font-family:'Courier New'; font-size:9pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: interface adds an item to the context menu when you right click a feed item. Typically an IBlogExtension adds the ability to post an RSS item to a blog from within RSS Bandit. However, there's no limit to the functionality one can add via a plug-in.

para.style: margin-top:14px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.style: line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: In order to build a plug-in for RSS Bandit, simply reference the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:'Courier New'; font-size:9pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: interface, and drop the compiled assembly in the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: directory within the directory where RSS Bandit is installed.

para.style: margin-top:14px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.style: line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: Sounds easy enough? I'll walk you through building a simple plug-in using Visual Studio .NET 2003. The plug-in we'll create will simply display the XML content of a feed item when you invoke the plug-in via the context menu. I assume that you are already familiar with building a class library with VS.NET.

para.style: margin-top:14px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: After starting up Visual Studio.NET, create a new Class Library project called MyPlugin as in figure 2.

para.style: margin-top:14px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;
line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.style: margin-top:14px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: The first thing you'll need to do is add a reference to the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: . There are two ways to obtain this dll. The first is to download a signed version from

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: . You can also look for the assembly in CVS in the following directory:

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: . As of this writing, the dll has the version 1.1.0.2.

para.style: margin-top:14px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: You'll also want to add a reference to System.Windows.Forms.dll.

para.style: margin-top:14px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: The IBlogExtension interface is intentionally quite simple. For your information, the source code for the interface is below.

para.text: method. When your plugin is called via the context menu, RSS Bandit will hand this method an

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: . The rssFragment is an instance of a class that implements the

link.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: interface. This provides a way to create an instance of

link.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: used to navigate over the underlying RSS item's XML via the

text.style: font-family:'Courier New'; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: The underlying XML will contain the source

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: document with all other RSS items removed. If the underlying feed is not RSS 2.0 (for example if the feed is an ATOM feed or an earlier version of RSS) Rss Bandit transforms the feed to RSS 2.0 prior to handing it off to the plugin. Therefore, the fragment will always be formatted as RSS 2.0. Actually displaying the underlying XML takes a bit of coding, but we'll roll up our sleeves and dive right in.

para.text: What the above code is doing is building an XSLT transformation

text.style: font-family:'Courier New'; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: using the identity stylesheet stored in the constant

text.style: font-family:'Courier New'; font-size:9pt; font-weight:bold; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;
font-family:Verdana; font-size:11pt; text-decoration:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000;

para.text: . The identity stylesheet transforms XML into itself. The reason I do this is its an easy way to look at the underlying XML of an XPathNavigator since the navigator is a forward only cursor through an underlying XML document and doesn't provide a simple means to get at the actual XML. Not only that, this demonstrates that you could apply any transformation you would like in your plug-in simply by changing the stylesheet involved.

para.text: The next step is to compile the assembly and place the resulting MyPlugin.dll into the plugins directory. Make sure to fully restart RSS Bandit. When it starts up again, it will examine every assembly within the plugins directory searching for types that implement the IBlogExtension interface. Each IBlogExtension derived type it finds will be added to the feed item context menu. As mentioned before, the name displayed in the menu is the value of the

para.text: This is a simple plug-in to display an RSS item's underlying xml. However, now you have the tools at your disposal to create much more interesting plug-ins than the one demonstrated here. If you do, please share them with everyone by posting a message in the
